articles.description: According to scientists, there are some clinical similarities between patients suffering from gram-negative Sepsis and Covid-19.The drug has recently been approved for marketing in India and would be available commercially as Sepsivac® from Ahmedabad-based Ca…
articles.content:
NEW DELHI :
Raising hopes for a potential treatment of Covid-19, Indias premier research organization Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) has decided to test its new drug against Sepsis to treat critical patients of Covid-19.The drug has rec… [+2688 chars]

articles.author: IANS
articles.title: Vaccine developed by 5 groups emerge as frontrunner to combat Covid-19, says ICMR - Livemint
articles.description: ICMR said the vaccines developed by five groups of scientists are in the process of coming into human trial phase after passing trials on animals
articles.content:
NEW DELHI :
The Indian Council of Medical Research on Sunday said that vaccines developed or observed for the novel coronavirus by five groups of scientists are in the process of coming into human trial phase after passing trials on animals.Speaking at a dai… [+907 chars]

articles.author: Mohana Basu
articles.title: Kerala hospital begins HCQ clinical trial even after ICMR says no basis for such studies - ThePrint
articles.description: The trial assumes the ICMR-recommended HCQ regimen is an ‘effective treatment’. However, ICMR chief epidemiologist says there isn’t enough evidence behind this.
articles.content: New Delhi: The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) believes there is no basis for a clinical trial to test the efficacy of hydroxychloroquine (HCQ) as a preventive drug to tackle Covid-19. But a hospital in Kerala has begun work on a trial registered wi… [+4828 chars]

articles.author: Kashmira Gander
articles.title: Hospitals Risk Being Overwhelmed with Child COVID-19 Cases, Warn Experts - Newsweek
articles.description: The fact children are less likely to die from or have severe COVID-19 has "created a sense of complacency that 'COVID-19 is not a major concern for children's health'," the scientists wrote.
articles.content:
Pediatric intensive care units in the U.S. could become overwhelmed by children sick with COVID-19, say scientists who estimate over 170,00 may already have been infected.
